info.game_comments:
2016 Power Players Week game 3.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: 4-letter word for the central part of the Earth or the muscles of the torso that provide stability

(2, 1).clue: This show's female lead was Carole Demas on Broadway, Olivia Newton-John on film & Julianne Hough live on TV

(3, 1).clue: With novels like "The Burning Hills" & "Silver Canyon", Louis L'Amour was a master of this fiction genre

(4, 1).clue: Its biggest university is Boise State

(1, 2).clue: The symbol for this element is He

(2, 2).clue: Elphaba goes green as a high-flying character in this magical musical

(3, 2).clue: Near Detroit's Hart Plaza is a huge statue of this boxer's fist, sans glove

(4, 2).clue: (David Muir presents the clue.)  Martha Raddatz & I moderated both Democratic & Republican 2016 primary debates; they took place in this state, the host of the nation's first primary

(2, 3).clue: In "West Side Story", Tony sings of his love for this young woman he's recently met

(3, 3).clue: In the 1970s bodybuilder & actor Lou Ferrigno brought this green guy to life on TV

(4, 3).clue: Cue the deer & antelope--this is Kansas' state song

(6, 3).clue: The one that was the name of a pope:George,Ringo,Paul

(1, 4).clue: You dilute a solution by watering it down; you do this to your pupils, 1 letter different, by making them expand

(2, 4).clue: A Liberian warlord known as General Butt Naked inspired an antagonist in this recent musical about missionaries in Africa

(3, 4).clue: Prior to becoming leader of the Nation of Islam, he was a Calypso singer

(4, 4).clue: In 1786 South Carolina's assembly met in Charleston to say let's blow this joint & move the capital here

(1, 5).clue: Charon is the largest moon of this small onetime planet

(2, 5).clue: Paperboys go on strike in this musical set in NYC in the late 1800s

(3, 5).clue: Appointed in 1916, he became the first Jewish Supreme Court justice

(4, 5).clue: This Western state is last in population with around 580,000

(1, 1).clue: In 1620 the Pilgrims landed at Provincetown on the tip of this cape

(2, 1).clue: Michelangelo was one of the leading figures of this great period of art in Italy from around 1400 to 1600

(3, 1).clue: Slaves in Washington, D.C. were freed in April 1862, 9 months before this January 1, 1863 manifesto

(4, 1).clue: Collective term for the Western Hemisphere after Columbus' voyages

(5, 1).clue: Dooley Wilson played this piano man in "Casablanca"

(6, 1).clue: Heinrich Heine:"Wherever they ____ books they will also, in the end, ____ human beings"

(1, 2).clue: This cape in Brevard County, Florida changed its name to honor John F. Kennedy & then back again

(2, 2).clue: This Cubist once said, "I paint objects as I think them, not as I see them"; that would explain it

(3, 2).clue: When D.C. burned in 1814, this office important to inventors was spared after its head pleaded with the British

(4, 2).clue: This "Gray Lady" published its first issue on September 18, 1851

(5, 2).clue: "A Shot in the Dark" is one of the movies with Peter Sellers as this bumbling policeman

(6, 2).clue: Hiram Johnson:"The first casualty when war comes is ____"

(1, 3).clue: There's Cape Horn & False Cape Horn at the bottom of this country on the west coast of South America

(2, 3).clue: In 1987 his "Irises" sold at auction for a then-record $53.9 million

(3, 3).clue: Recently, D.C.'s Latino population has grown with a very large number from this smallest Central American nation by area

(4, 3).clue: It runs from the Book of Matthew to Revelation

(5, 3).clue: The original name of this title character comes from a blend of the Japanese words for "gorilla" & "whale"

(6, 3).clue: Satchel Paige:"Don't ____ ____.  Something might be gaining on you"

(4, 4).clue: Here's our theme in this music style that first had a Grammy category in 1987
